page.title: 02POPULATION IN AREA
page.content: The demographic trends in the area are basically downwards. The last two national censuses reveal the total population falling from 529 to 488 - almost 8%. As there has been a slight increase in the total number of houses, the conclusion is that the average population per house has fallen. There are two main reasons for this which can probably be applied nationally in reasonably affluent rural areas. The birth rate has fallen so there are certainly fewer children in these villages. House prices have also risen considerably with the result that many house purchases in these villages can only be afforded by older people. Young wives find the isolation and lack of public transport facilities a discouragement to living rurally.
